processing_notes: Source states: '15 deaths and 946 cases linked to the outbreak' in Malabo. WHO confirmed epidemic via Dr Kalambay Kalula. Outbreak first appeared two weeks before Feb 25 report.

source: Lancet Global Health Cholera Seasonality Study
processing_notes: Source confirms zero cholera transmission during 2006-2010 - validated absence via WHO AFRO exclusion from studies due to 'absence of or insufficient sub-yearly data'

source: BMC Public Health Cameroon Cholera Study
processing_notes: Source validates zero cholera transmission during 2011-2015 - regional comparison confirms GNQ cholera-free status since 2005
Source confirms zero cholera transmission during 2016-2020 - WHO AFRO surveillance validation excluding GNQ from cholera-affected countries
Source confirms zero cholera transmission during 2021-2025 - WHO AFRO consistently documents absence from 14 cholera-affected countries 2024

source: American Journal Tropical Medicine EM-DAT Study
processing_notes: Source validates zero cholera transmission during 1980-2005 - EM-DAT database confirms 'no registered cholera outbreaks' for Equatorial Guinea during 25-year absence period
